channel.title: Pickup Error
channel.description: Ok I am using the Summon-Pkz cleaned version, and I am putting in new commands. The only problem I really have is the pickup it won't work on the client. I tried the pickup on the server, and nothing. I put a new one in it compiled perfect and it still didn't work, and yes I am typing it right. Does anyone know what the problem might be?

item.title: Pickup Error
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

if it has its own client tht is 317 is tht silab?

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup Error
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

b b0yz 4:

ye i guess it has its own client and no i didn’t switch back because it doesn’t work anyway, and the 00995 wont work ive tried it.

I’m seeing if ((newItemID <= 8000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {

In `Rich’s command…If your server is silab then you need your command, which was if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) {

And don’t just switch that part. Switch the whole command back…And I said IF it is silab.

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup Error
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

b b0yz 4:

im typing ::pickup 00995 2147000000 and it doesn’t work. None of them do. I know there is nothing wrong with them. Could it be the client or the source?

Is it a silab server and did you switch it back to your command?

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup Error
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

b b0yz 4:

im not retarded I’ve done ::pickup before, and tht really doesn’t help me. None of the pickup commands I have tried work.

There isn’t any errors with the commands that we gave you - It’s how you’re using them, which is the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup Error
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

b b0yz 4:

im not retarded I’ve done ::pickup before, and tht really doesn’t help me. None of the pickup commands I have tried work.

Oh my God… Did you follow what I said? I never called you retarded or anything. I’m saying you need to add an extra 0 onto your command when you’re typing it in. -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup Error
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

No oh my God… Switch back to your old pickup you had. If it’s a silab server which I’m 90% sure it is because of the way the code looks, if you want coins you need to put it ::pickup 00995 1 instead of ::pickup 0995 1 because with silab, the item IDs go into the 10,000s. So you need to put 00995 and not 0995.

Read full topic

rich it still didn’t work

item.title: Pickup Error
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

if (cmd.startsWith("pickup") && Rights > 1) { String[] args = cmd.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if ((newItemID <= 8000) && (newItemID >= 0)) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { Message("No such item."); } } else { Message("Wrong Syntax! Please use it as ::pickup [ID] [AMOUNT]."); } }

Edit it to work with your source.

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup Error
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

ye i tried all the pickup things and my player rights are 3 heres the command:

[code]if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerRights >= 2)) {
try {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12));
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));

            if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
            } else {
                sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist");
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("Cmon Type IT AGIAN ! ");
        }
    }[/code]

Read full topic
